channel.title: Good VPS
channel.description:
[font=courier]Hello. I'm wondering if anyone knows a good and reliable VPS company. We are using TrentaHost and they are absolute shit.
Please comment below. Thanks[/font]

item.title: Good VPS
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“sinisoul, post:29, topic:547316”][quote author=HcoJustin link=topic=666223.msg4454378#msg4454378 date=1413765165]

Okay, what would you do?

That 400mb figure you’re seeing is all of the game objects loaded into memory. You can safely unload regions that haven’t been touched in a while.

The actual size of the clipping mask is very small. Assuming a region of 104x104x4 that has a mask for every tile, you’re looking at ~170-340kb of ram. In reality a normal region uses ~40-80kb, and can even be reduced if you unload tiles that would never be accessed.
[/quote]

It’s closer to 1GB of data.[/quote]
For all of the game objects, probably. Depends on the class structure

Read full topic

item.title: Good VPS
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:27, topic:547316”][quote author=Ashi link=topic=666223.msg4454377#msg4454377 date=1413762656]
Okay, what would you do?
[/quote]
That 400mb figure you’re seeing is all of the game objects loaded into memory. You can safely unload regions that haven’t been touched in a while.

The actual size of the clipping mask is very small. Assuming a region of 104x104x4 that has a mask for every tile, you’re looking at ~170-340kb of ram. In reality a normal region uses ~40-80kb, and can even be reduced if you unload tiles that would never be accessed.[/quote]

It’s closer to 1GB of data.

Read full topic

item.title: Good VPS
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Ashi:

Okay, what would you do?

I’ve already said, a region bitmap and IDDFS search.

Read full topic

item.title: Good VPS
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

Ashi:

Okay, what would you do?

That 400mb figure you’re seeing is all of the game objects loaded into memory. You can safely unload regions that haven’t been touched in a while.

The actual size of the clipping mask is very small. Assuming a region of 104x104x4 that has a mask for every tile, you’re looking at ~170-340kb of ram. In reality a normal region uses ~40-80kb, and can even be reduced if you unload tiles that would never be accessed.

item.title: Good VPS
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:25, topic:547316”][quote author=Ashi link=topic=666223.msg4454329#msg4454329 date=1413747080]

If your path finding code is using 400MB of memory then you’re doing it wrong.

No, the higher version clients do not have path finding - it’s all handled server sided. Apollo does the same I think.

If your path finding code is using 400MB of memory then you’re doing it wrong.

Doesn’t matter, it shouldn’t use 400MB of memory.

Exactly, a 64x64 bitmap and an IDDFS for 2,000 players does not come anywhere close to 400MB.

No no.

If you look at apollo it uses rougly around 200mb. That’s for 317 though.

Look at this: https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,666228.0.html (it could be optimised, but still uses alot).
[/quote]
What makes you think Apollo is the best implementation?[/quote]
Okay, what would you do?

Read full topic

item.title: Good VPS
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Ashi, post:22, topic:547316”][quote author=t4 link=topic=666223.msg4454318#msg4454318 date=1413738912]

If your path finding code is using 400MB of memory then you’re doing it wrong.

No, the higher version clients do not have path finding - it’s all handled server sided. Apollo does the same I think.

If your path finding code is using 400MB of memory then you’re doing it wrong.

Doesn’t matter, it shouldn’t use 400MB of memory.

Exactly, a 64x64 bitmap and an IDDFS for 2,000 players does not come anywhere close to 400MB.
[/quote]
No no.

If you look at apollo it uses rougly around 200mb. That’s for 317 though.

Look at this: https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,666228.0.html (it could be optimised, but still uses alot).[/quote]
What makes you think Apollo is the best implementation?

Read full topic

item.title: Good VPS
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote=“marcbob, post:23, topic:547316”][quote author=Ashi link=topic=666223.msg4454189#msg4454189 date=1413654576]

Digital ocean, leaseweb, online.net.

DigitalOcean are also giving $100 credit away to students. That’s 20 months free hosting!
[/quote]
How can I claim that?

edit: I see how but it wants me to use my .edu to confirm i’m a student so i don’t see how you could claim multiple times. Also, I added the $100 and it still wants billing information hmmmm. Not sure if that’s a good idea when using for a private server[/quote]
I have a few student emails so I was able to do it multiple times. It does not charge your card anyway. Just use PayPal if you don’t want to link your card.

Read full topic

item.title: Good VPS
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

[quote=“Ashi, post:6, topic:547316”][quote author=t4 link=topic=666223.msg4454067#msg4454067 date=1413577940]
Digital ocean, leaseweb, online.net.
[/quote]
DigitalOcean are also giving $100 credit away to students. That’s 20 months free hosting![/quote]
How can I claim that?

edit: I see how but it wants me to use my .edu to confirm i’m a student so i don’t see how you could claim multiple times. Also, I added the $100 and it still wants billing information hmmmm. Not sure if that’s a good idea when using for a private server

Read full topic

item.title: Good VPS
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:21, topic:547316”][quote author=Pure_ link=topic=666223.msg4454316#msg4454316 date=1413736495]

If your path finding code is using 400MB of memory then you’re doing it wrong.

No, the higher version clients do not have path finding - it’s all handled server sided. Apollo does the same I think.

If your path finding code is using 400MB of memory then you’re doing it wrong.

Doesn’t matter, it shouldn’t use 400MB of memory.
[/quote]
Exactly, a 64x64 bitmap and an IDDFS for 2,000 players does not come anywhere close to 400MB.[/quote]
No no.

If you look at apollo it uses rougly around 200mb. That’s for 317 though.

Look at this: https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,666228.0.html (it could be optimised, but still uses alot).

Read full topic

item.title: Good VPS
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:13, topic:547316”][quote author=HcoJustin link=topic=666223.msg4454248#msg4454248 date=1413678562]

Digital ocean, leaseweb, online.net.

DigitalOcean are also giving $100 credit away to students. That’s 20 months free hosting!

20 Months on their $5 tier, which isn’t quite enough to host a private server.
[/quote]
Shitty designs, not hardware.[/quote]
Of course, but what you can support on 512mb of ram and 1 core won’t be the greatest.

Read full topic

item.title: Good VPS
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:13, topic:547316”][quote author=HcoJustin link=topic=666223.msg4454248#msg4454248 date=1413678562]

Digital ocean, leaseweb, online.net.

DigitalOcean are also giving $100 credit away to students. That’s 20 months free hosting!

20 Months on their $5 tier, which isn’t quite enough to host a private server.
[/quote]
Shitty designs, not hardware.[/quote]
Can be, but I’ve used a server that used 800mb and another which used 400mb. Stuff like path finding does that. Just most of the crap out there hacks it
